column4: I installed wine, I tried wine program.exe but it shows an error. I also tried wine --help and all I get is wine program argument.. whats the right command for wine please?
'program.exe' is just a placeholder. You should replace it with the name of a real program
Yes. that was jsut an example. the real program is NetworkAdmin.exe :)
you could put that error on a pastebin and ask the people in #wine about it. Or you could try the latest wine version, which is available through an inofficial repository... see the factoid:
sure thanks. will do, but do you have any idea how to run .exe file with wine via the terminal?
the way you tried it was correct.
you might pastebin the error and give me the URL, in case it's something obviouse
ah ok.. thanks for ur help anyway :)
use http://paste.ubuntu.com
I would do but am in windows now. will paste it if i got the chance..
what does this networkadmin thing do? Perhaps there is a Linux alternative.

well, it lets you restrict access to every computer, apply executable patches remotely, and schedule reboots, shutdowns, and Windows Explorer restarts from a single administrator's computer connected to a TCP/IP-based network or Internet..
sounds like a tool for Windows networks that should be run from a Windows machine
do you think it won't work for ubuntu?
I think it will be a kludge to administer a network of Windows machines from Ubuntu.
ok ok.. I understand your point. :)
one more question please, how do i log the terminal? I want the terminal to log all the commands i've used? any idea?
it does so automatically, in the file ~/.bash_history
you can just enter 'history' to see the list in chronological order
aha.. ok thanks again :)

I need your help.. I can't enable desktop effects and I can't enable my video card, I also checked my laptop for 3D acceleration and the result was: direct rendring: No (If you want to find out why, try setting LIBGL_DEBUG=verbose)
